Note: For other MSS see 1059; and for a prose version see Oxford, Bodleian Library Bodley 789 (SC 2643), ff. 1-51v.
Title(s): ‘Medytacyuns of þe Soper of our Lord Ihesu’
_description: Robert of Brunne, ‘Medytacyuns of þe Soper of our Lord Ihesu’ — 1142 lines in couplets

Bod415.First Lines:
Almyghty god in triniteNow & euer wyþ vs
                    be…
Bod415.Last Lines:
…To þat pes perelles we preie þou vs bringgeThat
                    liuest & reinest wiþ outen endingge
Bod415.Attributed Title:
Here bygynnen medytacyuns of þe soper of our lord Ihesus and also of
                    hys passyun and eke of þe peynes of his swete moder mayden Marye þe
                    whyche made yn latyn Bonauenture Cardynall (f. 80)

CamTCC305.First Lines:
Almyȝti god in trinitenow & euere wiþ vs beffor
                    þi loues passiounal þis congregacioun…
CamTCC305.Last Lines:
…To þat pees pereles we preie þou vs bringeÞat
                    lyueþ and regneþ wiþouten endyng

BLAdd36983.First Lines:
Almyghty God in treniteNow & euer with us
                    be…
BLAdd36983.Last Lines:
…Þat satt in derknes of deþ & diseseÞu
                    liste hem & lede hem in þe way of pace
BLAdd36983.Attributed Author:
compiled of bon aventure a gode clerk & a cardinall of Rome (f.
                        118rb)
BLAdd36983.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth þe meditation of þe pascion of crist & of
                    þe lamentation of oure lady Saint Mary þat sche made for her son when
                    sche se hym torment among þe Iewis (f. 118rb)

BLHar1701.First Lines:
Alle myȝty god yn trynyteNow & euer wyþ vs
                    be…
BLHar1701.Last Lines:
…To þat pes pereles we prey þou vs bryngÞat
                    leuyst and reynest with oute endyng
BLHar1701.Note:
The text starts on the lower half of the page, spanning both
                    columns.
BLHar1701.Attributed Title:
Here bygynneþ medytacyuns of þe soper of oure lorde Ihesu And
                    also of hys passyun and eke of þe peynes of hys swete modyr mayden marye
                    þe whyche made yn latyn Bonauenture Cardynall (rubricated RT, f.
                    1)

Lam559.First Lines:
Almyȝgti god in trintienowh & euer with thou
                    be…
Lam559.Last Lines:
…to that peace thou vs bringethat lyuyth and regnith with
                    outin endynge. Amen
Lam559.Note: Written as prose. Fol. 120 is very worn.
Lam559.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the passion of oure lord Ihesu criste (f. 89, foot of page,
                    in rubric); Here endith cristes passion… (f. 120, rubric)
